content.question: Which of the following best explains why particular <math alttext="M U P" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>MUP</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> protein variants are associated with male dominance in individuals in populations of wild mice?

choices.label: Viral infections introduced new <math alttext="M U P" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>M</mi><mi>U</mi><mi>P</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> alleles into affected populations.

Environmental stress caused a decreased rate of mutations in the <math alttext="M U P" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>M</mi><mi>U</mi><mi>P</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> genes of subordinate mice.

Interbreeding between different mouse species introduced new <math alttext="M U P" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>M</mi><mi>U</mi><mi>P</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> alleles into the populations.

The <math alttext="M U P" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>M</mi><mi>U</mi><mi>P</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> genes are located on a chromosome near genes associated with phenotypes of dominant males.

content.answer: The <math alttext="M U P" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>M</mi><mi>U</mi><mi>P</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> genes are located on a chromosome near genes associated with phenotypes of dominant males.

skill.text: 1.C: Explain biological concepts and processes in applied contexts.
